name: Lippia crucifera
distribution: Rio Grande do Sul (Brazil South, Brazil, Southern America)
locality: Alegrete, estrada do Durasnal, bacia do Lajeado Grande
remarks: doi:10.1007/s12228-021-09673-w The specific epithet refers to the arrangement of the distal leaves, which resemble a cross when viewed from above, due to the reduced upper internodes.

name: Lippia misionera

locality: Brazil: Rio Grande do Sul: Santiago, RS287, 2.6 km após trevo acesso a RS168
remarks: doi:10.5902/2358198086552 Etymology: 'Misionero means an inhabitant or belonging to the former Jesuit missions, established in lands in the northeast of Argentina, the western portion of Rio Grande do Sul state (Brazil) and Paraguay'.
